MemoryInfobox.description: 'Kassandra wanted information on Myrrine|her mother. The priest wanted a proper sacrifice to appease the gods and heal the dying. Once again, Kassandra found herself responsible for the lives of the sick.'

General_Description: '''A Heart for a Head''' was a virtual representation of one of [[Kassandra]]'s genetic memories, relived by [[Layla Hassan]] through the Portable [[Animus|Animus HR-8.5]].
Section_Description: In order to gain information on the movements of her [[Myrrine|mother]], Kassandra was tasked by a [[Priests of Asklepios|priest]] of [[Asklepios]] to bring in a suitable sacrifice to save the sick.
Section_Dialogue:
Kassandra made her way to [[Mount Koryphum]] to locate and subdue the white [[Cattle|bull]]. [[Bandit]]s ranged the ruins, and it seemed they had gotten to the bull first, for it lay dead within their camp in the [[Asine Ruins]]. *'''Kassandra:''' ''The white bull. Am I too late?'' Kassandra snuck her way into the camp, retrieving what she could from the carcass. *'''Kassandra:''' ''Doesn't look like he died "willingly." I'll take his heart for the sacrifice—it'll have to do.
Ugh. Not the best feeling.
I hope the heart is enough. If they want the whole bull, they can come get it themselves.'' She snuck away, then returned to the [[Sanctuary of Asklepios]]. *'''Priest:''' ''Did you find the white bull?'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''I couldn't bring it back alive, but I did manage to collect its heart.'' *'''Priest:''' ''This won't be enough to please Asklepios. The beast died unwillingly, and with just the heart, we'll only be able to pray for one life.'' Patients began approaching. *'''[[Eteokles (Argolian)|Farmer]]:''' ''Please, ''misthios''. The white bull you killed was mine. My farm feeds half of [[Argolis]]. If I die, people will starve.'' *'''Wealthy woman:''' ''I beg you! My husband was killed by the [[Plague of Athens|sickness]]. I have two small children. Who will take care of them if I die? I am wealthy, and will pay you for this blessing.'' *'''Child:''' ''It's OK, give the sacrifice to them.'' *'''Priest:''' ''You did this. You choose whose prayers get heard by the gods.'' |-|The farmer.= *'''Kassandra:''' ''Pray for the farmer. The bull was his, its sacrifice will help feed the people of Argolis.'' *'''Farmer:''' ''Thank you, ''misthios''.'' *'''Priest:''' ''Very well.'' The wealthy woman turned away, forlorn. |-|The wealthy woman.= *'''Kassandra:''' ''Pray for this woman. The world has too many orphans already.'' *'''Civilian:''' ''Gods bless you, ''misthios''! My children thank you.'' *'''Farmer:''' ''You'll pay for this!'' The farmer turned away, angry. *'''Priest:''' ''It will be done.'' |-|The girl.= *'''Kassandra:''' ''I know what it's like to be small and forsaken. Pray for the girl.'' *'''Farmer:''' ''You'll regret this!'' *'''Priest:''' ''Not an easy choice, ''misthios''. But it's been made.'' The wealthy mother cried and turned away. *'''Priest:''' ''The rest is in the hands of the gods.'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''I did my part, priest.'' *'''Priest:''' ''This [[Sparta]]n woman you're after...'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''You've met her?'' *'''Priest:''' ''Her visit to the sanctuary is legendary, but sadly it was before my time. The man you want is [[Mydon]] the Elder Priest. He spoke of her often. That is, before he cut out his tongue.'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''Cut out his tongue?'' *'''Priest:''' ''When he's not healing the sick he's in the [[Guesthouse, Argolis|guesthouse]]. Spends a lot of his time being... tended to by servants.'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''Thank you. I won't forget you helped me.'' *'''Priest:''' ''And these people won't forget you helped them.''
Section_Outcome: Kassandra helped the priest with sickness issue and learned the name and location of Mydon, an elder priest who met her mother.
Section_Behind_the_scenes:
This is the only quest in the Sanctuary of Asklepios that actually advances the main quest. [[Timoxenos]] gives the player the Spartan baby blanket in which Myrrine wrapped her injured [[Alexios|baby]] but can't help them any further than that, and [[Pylenor]] doesn't actually know anything useful.

The choice in this quest determines a later impact quest. If the farmer is chosen, [[Falling on Deaf Ears]] becomes available.
